user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_BSP_GetResourceTypeConfig:
```c
uint32 OS_BSP_GetResourceTypeConfig(uint32 ResourceType)
{
    uint32 ConfigOptionValue;

    if (ResourceType < OS_OBJECT_TYPE_USER)
    {
        ConfigOptionValue = OS_BSP_Global.ResoureConfig[ResourceType];
    }
    else
    {
        ConfigOptionValue = 0;
    }

    return ConfigOptionValue;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_BSP_GetResourceTypeConfig:
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_USER 0x10
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Other parts of the function are simple, reachable constructs and do not on their own present obvious unreachable-code concerns: the function header and return statement are required and executed; the local variable declaration (uint32 ConfigOptionValue;) is necessary storage and not unreachable; the macro definition (#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_USER 0x10) is a compile-time constant and does not itself constitute unreachable code. The suspected fragments listed above cover the conditional and each branch assignment that could be unreachable depending on how ResourceType is constrained elsewhere (preconditions, caller behavior, or additional invariants), so they are the relevant places to investigate for possible unreachable code per MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1.
